00065 static inline int ext2_test_bit(int nr, const void *addr)
00066 {
00067 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
00068         const unsigned char *tmp = addr;
00069         return (tmp[nr >> 3] >> (nr & 7)) & 1;
00070 #else
00071         const unsigned long *tmp = addr;
00072         return ((1UL << (nr & (__WORDSIZE - 1))) &
00073                 ((tmp)[nr / __WORDSIZE])) != 0;
00074 #endif
00075 }

00110 int is_fstype_ext(int fd)
00111 {
00112         struct statfs           st;
00113         int                     rc;
00114 
00115         rc = fstatfs(fd, &st);
00116         if (rc < 0) {
00117                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "Got statfs error.");
00118                 return -errno;
00119         }
00120 
00121         return (st.f_type == EXT4_SUPER_MAGIC);
00122 }

00139 #define OSD_OI_FID_NR         (1UL << 7)
00140 static void print_log_path(struct llog_logid_rec *lid, int is_ext)
00141 {
00142 
00143         char                    object_path[255];
00144         struct lu_fid           fid_from_logid;
00145 
00146         logid_to_fid(&lid->lid_id, &fid_from_logid);
00147 
00148         if (is_ext)
00149                 snprintf(object_path, sizeof(object_path),
00150                          "O/%ju/d%u/%u", (uintmax_t)fid_from_logid.f_seq,
00151                          fid_from_logid.f_oid % 32,
00152                          fid_from_logid.f_oid);
00153         else
00154                 snprintf(object_path, sizeof(object_path),
00155                          "oi.%ju/"DFID_NOBRACE,
00156                          (uintmax_t)(fid_from_logid.f_seq & (OSD_OI_FID_NR - 1)),
00157                          PFID(&fid_from_logid));
00158 
00159         printf("ogen=%X id="DOSTID" path=%s\n",
00160                 lid->lid_id.lgl_ogen, POSTID(&lid->lid_id.lgl_oi),
00161                 object_path);
00162 }
00163 
00164 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00165 {
00166         int rc = 0;
00167         int is_ext;
00168         int fd, rec_number;
00169         struct llog_log_hdr *llog_buf = NULL;
00170         struct llog_rec_hdr **recs_buf = NULL;
00171 
00172         setlinebuf(stdout);
00173 
00174         if (argc != 2) {
00175                 printf("Usage: llog_reader filename\n");
00176                 return -1;
00177         }
00178 
00179         fd = open(argv[1], O_RDONLY);
00180         if (fd < 0) {
00181                 rc = -errno;
00182                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "Could not open the file %s.",
00183                             argv[1]);
00184                 goto out;
00185         }
00186 
00187         is_ext = is_fstype_ext(fd);
00188         if (is_ext < 0) {
00189                 rc = is_ext;
00190                 printf("Unable to determine type of filesystem containing %s\n",
00191                        argv[1]);
00192                 goto out_fd;
00193         }
00194 
00195         rc = llog_pack_buffer(fd, &llog_buf, &recs_buf, &rec_number);
00196         if (rc < 0) {
00197                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "Could not pack buffer.");
00198                 goto out_fd;
00199         }
00200 
00201         print_llog_header(llog_buf);
00202         print_records(recs_buf, rec_number, is_ext);
00203         llog_unpack_buffer(fd, llog_buf, recs_buf);
00204 
00205 out_fd:
00206         close(fd);
00207 out:
00208         return rc;
00209 }
00210 
00211 
00212 
00213 int llog_pack_buffer(int fd, struct llog_log_hdr **llog,
00214                      struct llog_rec_hdr ***recs,
00215                      int *recs_number)
00216 {
00217         int rc = 0, recs_num, rd = 0;
00218         long long file_size;
00219         struct stat st;
00220         char *file_buf = NULL, *recs_buf = NULL;
00221         struct llog_rec_hdr **recs_pr = NULL;
00222         char *ptr = NULL;
00223         int i;
00224 
00225         rc = fstat(fd, &st);
00226         if (rc < 0) {
00227                 rc = -errno;
00228                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "Got file stat error.");
00229                 goto out;
00230         }
00231 
00232         file_size = st.st_size;
00233         if (file_size < sizeof(**llog)) {
00234                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00235                             "File too small for llog header: "
00236                             "need %zd, size %lld\n",
00237                             sizeof(**llog), file_size);
00238                 rc = -EIO;
00239                 goto out;
00240         }
00241 
00242         file_buf = malloc(file_size);
00243         if (file_buf == NULL) {
00244                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00245                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc, "Memory Alloc for file_buf.");
00246                 goto out;
00247         }
00248         *llog = (struct llog_log_hdr *)file_buf;
00249 
00250         do {
00251                 rc = read(fd, file_buf + rd, file_size - rd);
00252                 if (rc > 0)
00253                         rd += rc;
00254         } while (rc > 0 && rd < file_size);
00255 
00256         if (rd < file_size) {
00257                 rc = rc < 0 ? -errno : -EIO;
00258                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00259                             "Error reading llog header: need %zd, got %d",
00260                             sizeof(**llog), rd);
00261                 goto clear_file_buf;
00262         }
00263 
00264         /* the llog header not countable here.*/
00265         recs_num = le32_to_cpu((*llog)->llh_count) - 1;
00266 
00267         recs_buf = malloc(recs_num * sizeof(**recs_pr));
00268         if (recs_buf == NULL) {
00269                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00270                 llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00271                             "Error allocating %zd bytes for recs_buf",
00272                             recs_num * sizeof(**recs_pr));
00273                 goto clear_file_buf;
00274         }
00275         recs_pr = (struct llog_rec_hdr **)recs_buf;
00276 
00277         ptr = file_buf + le32_to_cpu((*llog)->llh_hdr.lrh_len);
00278         i = 0;
00279 
00280         while (ptr < (file_buf + file_size)) {
00281                 struct llog_rec_hdr *cur_rec;
00282                 int idx;
00283                 unsigned long offset;
00284 
00285                 if (ptr + sizeof(**recs_pr) > file_buf + file_size) {
00286                         rc = -EINVAL;
00287                         llapi_error(LLAPI_MSG_ERROR, rc,
00288                                     "The log is corrupt (too big at %d)", i);
00289                         goto clear_recs_buf;
00290                 }
00291 
00292                 cur_rec = (struct llog_rec_hdr *)ptr;
00293                 idx = le32_to_cpu(cur_rec->lrh_index);
00294                 recs_pr[i] = cur_rec;
00295                 offset = (unsigned long)ptr - (unsigned long)file_buf;
00296                 if (cur_rec->lrh_len == 0 ||
00297                     cur_rec->lrh_len > (*llog)->llh_hdr.lrh_len) {
00298                         cur_rec->lrh_len = (*llog)->llh_hdr.lrh_len -
00299                                 offset % (*llog)->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00300                         printf("off %lu skip %u to next chunk.\n", offset,
00301                                cur_rec->lrh_len);
00302                         i--;
00303                 } else if (ext2_test_bit(idx, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(*llog))) {
00304                         printf("rec #%d type=%x len=%u offset %lu\n", idx,
00305                                cur_rec->lrh_type, cur_rec->lrh_len, offset);
00306                 } else {
00307                         printf("Bit %d of %d not set\n", idx, recs_num);
00308                         cur_rec->lrh_id = CANCELLED;
00309                         /* The header counts only set records */
00310                         i--;
00311                 }
00312 
00313                 ptr += le32_to_cpu(cur_rec->lrh_len);
00314                 if ((ptr - file_buf) > file_size) {
00315                         printf("The log is corrupt (too big at %d)\n", i);
00316                         rc = -EINVAL;
00317                         goto clear_recs_buf;
00318                 }
00319                 i++;
00320         }
00321 
00322         *recs = recs_pr;
00323         *recs_number = recs_num;
00324 
00325 out:
00326         return rc;
00327 
00328 clear_recs_buf:
00329         free(recs_buf);
00330 
00331 clear_file_buf:
00332         free(file_buf);
00333 
00334         *llog = NULL;
00335         goto out;
00336 }
00337 
00338 void llog_unpack_buffer(int fd, struct llog_log_hdr *llog_buf,
00339                         struct llog_rec_hdr **recs_buf)
00340 {
00341         free(llog_buf);
00342         free(recs_buf);
00343         return;
00344 }
00345 
00346 void print_llog_header(struct llog_log_hdr *llog_buf)
00347 {
00348         time_t t;
00349 
00350         printf("Header size : %u\n",
00351                le32_to_cpu(llog_buf->llh_hdr.lrh_len));
00352 
00353         t = le64_to_cpu(llog_buf->llh_timestamp);
00354         printf("Time : %s", ctime(&t));
00355 
00356         printf("Number of records: %u\n",
00357                le32_to_cpu(llog_buf->llh_count)-1);
00358 
00359         printf("Target uuid : %s \n",
00360                (char *)(&llog_buf->llh_tgtuuid));
00361 
00362         /* Add the other info you want to view here */
00363 
00364         printf("-----------------------\n");
00365         return;
00366 }
00367 
00368 static void print_1_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00369 {
00370         int i;
00371 
00372         if (lcfg->lcfg_nid)
00373                 printf("nid=%s(%#jx)  ", libcfs_nid2str(lcfg->lcfg_nid),
00374                        (uintmax_t)lcfg->lcfg_nid);
00375         if (lcfg->lcfg_nal)
00376                 printf("nal=%d ", lcfg->lcfg_nal);
00377         for (i = 0; i <  lcfg->lcfg_bufcount; i++)
00378                 printf("%d:%.*s  ", i, lcfg->lcfg_buflens[i],
00379                        (char*)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, i));
00380         return;
00381 }
00382 
00383 
00384 static void print_setup_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00385 {
00386         struct lov_desc *desc;
00387 
00388         if ((lcfg->lcfg_bufcount == 2) &&
00389             (lcfg->lcfg_buflens[1] == sizeof(*desc))) {
00390                 printf("lov_setup ");
00391                 printf("0:%s  ", lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
00392                 printf("1:(struct lov_desc)\n");
00393                 desc = (struct lov_desc*)(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00394                 printf("\t\tuuid=%s  ", (char*)desc->ld_uuid.uuid);
00395                 printf("stripe:cnt=%u ", desc->ld_default_stripe_count);
00396                 printf("size=%ju ", (uintmax_t)desc->ld_default_stripe_size);
00397                 printf("offset=%ju ",
00398                        (uintmax_t)desc->ld_default_stripe_offset);
00399                 printf("pattern=%#x", desc->ld_pattern);
00400         } else {
00401                 printf("setup     ");
00402                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00403         }
00404 
00405         return;
00406 }
00407 
00408 void print_lustre_cfg(struct lustre_cfg *lcfg, int *skip)
00409 {
00410         enum lcfg_command_type cmd = le32_to_cpu(lcfg->lcfg_command);
00411 
00412         if (*skip > 0)
00413                 printf("SKIP ");
00414 
00415         switch(cmd){
00416         case(LCFG_ATTACH):{
00417                 printf("attach    ");
00418                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00419                 break;
00420         }
00421         case(LCFG_SETUP):{
00422                 print_setup_cfg(lcfg);
00423                 break;
00424         }
00425         case(LCFG_DETACH):{
00426                 printf("detach    ");
00427                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00428                 break;
00429         }
00430         case(LCFG_CLEANUP):{
00431                 printf("cleanup   ");
00432                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00433                 break;
00434         }
00435         case(LCFG_ADD_UUID):{
00436                 printf("add_uuid  ");
00437                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00438                 break;
00439         }
00440         case(LCFG_DEL_UUID):{
00441                 printf("del_uuid  ");
00442                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00443                 break;
00444         }
00445         case(LCFG_ADD_CONN):{
00446                 printf("add_conn  ");
00447                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00448                 break;
00449         }
00450         case(LCFG_DEL_CONN):{
00451                 printf("del_conn  ");
00452                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00453                 break;
00454         }
00455         case(LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD):{
00456                 printf("lov_modify_tgts add ");
00457                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00458                 break;
00459         }
00460         case(LCFG_LOV_DEL_OBD):{
00461                 printf("lov_modify_tgts del ");
00462                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00463                 break;
00464         }
00465         case(LCFG_ADD_MDC):{
00466                 printf("modify_mdc_tgts add ");
00467                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00468                 break;
00469         }
00470         case(LCFG_DEL_MDC):{
00471                 printf("modify_mdc_tgts del ");
00472                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00473                 break;
00474         }
00475         case(LCFG_MOUNTOPT):{
00476                 printf("mount_option ");
00477                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00478                 break;
00479         }
00480         case(LCFG_DEL_MOUNTOPT):{
00481                 printf("del_mount_option ");
00482                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00483                 break;
00484         }
00485         case(LCFG_SET_TIMEOUT):{
00486                 printf("set_timeout=%d ", lcfg->lcfg_num);
00487                 break;
00488         }
00489         case(LCFG_SET_LDLM_TIMEOUT):{
00490                 printf("set_ldlm_timeout=%d ", lcfg->lcfg_num);
00491                 break;
00492         }
00493         case(LCFG_SET_UPCALL):{
00494                 printf("set_lustre_upcall ");
00495                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00496                 break;
00497         }
00498         case(LCFG_PARAM):{
00499                 printf("param ");
00500                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00501                 break;
00502         }
00503         case(LCFG_SET_PARAM):{
00504                 printf("set_param ");
00505                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00506                 break;
00507         }
00508         case(LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF):{
00509                 printf("sptlrpc_conf ");
00510                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00511                 break;
00512         }
00513         case(LCFG_MARKER):{
00514                 struct cfg_marker *marker = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00515                 char createtime[26], canceltime[26] = "";
00516                 time_t time_tmp;
00517 
00518                 if (marker->cm_flags & CM_START &&
00519                     marker->cm_flags & CM_SKIP) {
00520                         printf("SKIP START ");
00521                         (*skip)++;
00522                 } else if (marker->cm_flags & CM_END) {
00523                         printf(     "END   ");
00524                         *skip = 0;
00525                 }
00526 
00527                 if (marker->cm_flags & CM_EXCLUDE) {
00528                         if (marker->cm_flags & CM_START)
00529                                 printf("EXCLUDE START ");
00530                         else
00531                                 printf("EXCLUDE END   ");
00532                 }
00533 
00534                 /* Handle overflow of 32-bit time_t gracefully.
00535                  * The copy to time_tmp is needed in any case to
00536                  * keep the pointer happy, even on 64-bit systems. */
00537                 time_tmp = marker->cm_createtime;
00538                 if (time_tmp == marker->cm_createtime) {
00539                         ctime_r(&time_tmp, createtime);
00540                         createtime[strlen(createtime) - 1] = 0;
00541                 } else {
00542                         strcpy(createtime, "in the distant future");
00543                 }
00544 
00545                 if (marker->cm_canceltime) {
00546                         /* Like cm_createtime, we try to handle overflow of
00547                          * 32-bit time_t gracefully. The copy to time_tmp
00548                          * is also needed on 64-bit systems to keep the
00549                          * pointer happy, see bug 16771 */
00550                         time_tmp = marker->cm_canceltime;
00551                         if (time_tmp == marker->cm_canceltime) {
00552                                 ctime_r(&time_tmp, canceltime);
00553                                 canceltime[strlen(canceltime) - 1] = 0;
00554                         } else {
00555                                 strcpy(canceltime, "in the distant future");
00556                         }
00557                 }
00558 
00559                 printf("marker %3d (flags=%#04x, v%d.%d.%d.%d) %-15s '%s' %s-%s",
00560                        marker->cm_step, marker->cm_flags,
00561                        OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(marker->cm_vers),
00562                        OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(marker->cm_vers),
00563                        OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(marker->cm_vers),
00564                        OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(marker->cm_vers),
00565                        marker->cm_tgtname, marker->cm_comment,
00566                        createtime, canceltime);
00567                 break;
00568         }
00569         case(LCFG_POOL_NEW):{
00570                 printf("pool new ");
00571                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00572                 break;
00573         }
00574         case(LCFG_POOL_ADD):{
00575                 printf("pool add ");
00576                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00577                 break;
00578         }
00579         case(LCFG_POOL_REM):{
00580                 printf("pool remove ");
00581                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00582                 break;
00583         }
00584         case(LCFG_POOL_DEL):{
00585                 printf("pool destroy ");
00586                 print_1_cfg(lcfg);
00587                 break;
00588         }
00589         default:
00590                 printf("unsupported cmd_code = %x\n",cmd);
00591         }
00592         printf("\n");
00593         return;
00594 }
00595 
00596 static void print_hsm_action(struct llog_agent_req_rec *larr)
00597 {
00598         char    buf[12];
00599         int     sz;
00600 
00601         sz = larr->arr_hai.hai_len - sizeof(larr->arr_hai);
00602         printf("lrh=[type=%X len=%d idx=%d] fid="DFID
00603                " compound/cookie=%#jx/%#jx"
00604                " status=%s action=%s archive#=%d flags=%#jx"
00605                " create=%ju change=%ju"
00606                " extent=%#jx-%#jx gid=%#jx datalen=%d"
00607                " data=[%s]\n",
00608                larr->arr_hdr.lrh_type,
00609                larr->arr_hdr.lrh_len, larr->arr_hdr.lrh_index,
00610                PFID(&larr->arr_hai.hai_fid),
00611                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_compound_id,
00612                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_hai.hai_cookie,
00613                agent_req_status2name(larr->arr_status),
00614                hsm_copytool_action2name(larr->arr_hai.hai_action),
00615                larr->arr_archive_id,
00616                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_flags,
00617                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_req_create,
00618                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_req_change,
00619                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_hai.hai_extent.offset,
00620                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_hai.hai_extent.length,
00621                (uintmax_t)larr->arr_hai.hai_gid, sz,
00622                hai_dump_data_field(&larr->arr_hai, buf, sizeof(buf)));
00623 }
00624 
00625 void print_changelog_rec(struct llog_changelog_rec *rec)
00626 {
00627         printf("changelog record id:0x%x cr_flags:0x%x cr_type:%s(0x%x)\n",
00628                le32_to_cpu(rec->cr_hdr.lrh_id),
00629                le32_to_cpu(rec->cr.cr_flags),
00630                changelog_type2str(le32_to_cpu(rec->cr.cr_type)),
00631                le32_to_cpu(rec->cr.cr_type));
00632 }
00633 
00634 static void print_records(struct llog_rec_hdr **recs,
00635                           int rec_number, int is_ext)
00636 {
00637         __u32 lopt;
00638         int i, skip = 0;
00639 
00640         for (i = 0; i < rec_number; i++) {
00641                 printf("#%.2d (%.3d)", le32_to_cpu(recs[i]->lrh_index),
00642                        le32_to_cpu(recs[i]->lrh_len));
00643 
00644                 lopt = le32_to_cpu(recs[i]->lrh_type);
00645 
00646                 if (recs[i]->lrh_id == CANCELLED)
00647                         printf("NOT SET ");
00648 
00649                 switch (lopt) {
00650                 case OBD_CFG_REC:
00651                         print_lustre_cfg(
00652                                 (struct lustre_cfg *)((char *)(recs[i]) +
00653                                 sizeof(struct llog_rec_hdr)), &skip);
00654                         break;
00655                 case LLOG_PAD_MAGIC:
00656                         printf("padding\n");
00657                         break;
00658                 case LLOG_LOGID_MAGIC:
00659                         print_log_path((struct llog_logid_rec *)recs[i],
00660                                        is_ext);
00661                         break;
00662                 case HSM_AGENT_REC:
00663                         print_hsm_action((struct llog_agent_req_rec *)recs[i]);
00664                         break;
00665                 case CHANGELOG_REC:
00666                         print_changelog_rec((struct llog_changelog_rec *)
00667                                             recs[i]);
00668                         break;
00669                 case CHANGELOG_USER_REC:
00670                         printf("changelog_user record id:0x%x\n",
00671                                le32_to_cpu(recs[i]->lrh_id));
00672                         break;
00673                 default:
00674                         printf("unknown type %x\n", lopt);
00675                         break;
00676                 }
00677         }
00678 }
